tool.name: CalcKsat

param.name: Output_folder
param.pythonReference: Specify the path and folder name where output from this tool will be stored.

param.name: Input_shapefile
param.displayname: Input soil shapefile with water content information
param.dialogReference: Specify the path and filename where the input shapefile is located.

param.name: Ksat_of_choice
param.expression: Cosby et al. (1984) | Puckett et al. (1985) | Jabro (1992) | Campbell and Shiozawa (1994) | Ferrer Julia et al. (2004) - Sand | Ferrer Julia et al. (2004) - Sand, clay, OM | Brakensiek et al. (1984) | Ahuja et al. (1989) | Minasny and McBratney (2000)
param.dialogReference: Choose an equation from the dropdown menu to calculate Ksat.

param.name: Field_FieldCapacity
param.displayname: Field containing water content (vol) for field capacity
param.dialogReference:
Specify the name of the field within the input shapefile that contains the volumetric water content for field capacity.

NOTE: If this information is not available in the input data, it is recommended to run the other tools in this toolbox first.

param.name: Field_Saturation
param.displayname: Field containing water content (vol) for saturation
param.dialogReference:
Specify the name of the field within the input shapefile that contains the volumetric water content for saturation.

NOTE: If this information is not available in the input data, it is recommended to run the other tools in this toolbox first.

param.name: Carbon_content
param.displayname: Carbon: Does your dataset contain organic carbon or organic matter?
param.dialogReference: Specify if your input soil shapefile contains carbon information as organic carbon or organic matter.

tool.summary:
This tool calculates saturated hydraulic conductivity (Ksat) using input soil data.

NOTE:Some of these equations require water content at field capacity and/or saturation. It is recommended that the user runs the other tools in this toolbox first to calculate water content (volumetric) at these thresholds.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This tool calculates saturated hydraulic conductivity (Ksat) using input soil data.

NOTE:Some of these equations require water content at field capacity and/or saturation. It is recommended that the user runs the other tools in this toolbox first to calculate water content (volumetric) at these thresholds.
